title: Tips for drawing the letter S
content:
Do you have any tips on how you approach drawing the letter S?

All I seem to be able to do is make a hot mess of beziers.
author: eyeRhyme

comments.content: [Note, I am trying to keep as many of the points as vertical and horizontal as I can, in order to make clean paths.]

Some good stuff –especially by John Hudson– here:  
 [http://www.typophile.com/node/96989](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417080418/http:/www.typophile.com/node/96989 "http://www.typophile.com/node/96989")

hhp
Thanks, hrant...I thought it might be a common question, but I was not sure how to search for it here. I'll see if those tips help me slay my dragon.

A bit of a hassle to find on the site, but there is a very comprehensive description about constructing /s/ on  
 [http://briem.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417080418/http:/briem.net/ "http://briem.net")

Of course, that letter famously gave Donald Knuth difficulty when working on Computer Modern.

[https://projecteuclid.org/euclid.bams/euclid.bams/1183544082](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417080418/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fprojecteuclid.org/euclid.bams/euclid.bams/1183544082)
